reviews.review_msg:
Dr. Farrales clearly really cares about the subject she's teaching.
Her teaching methods & assignments are varied & not super rigid/traditional -- it was a pretty fun course.
There is a group assignment that I didn't love but it's not a deal breaker.
Paper marking is a bit strict but fair.

Dr. Farrales is a tough grader, but an excellent prof. I appreciated being pushed more than in some other geography courses, and I learnt so much in her course. Our assignments were quite interesting, and the readings she assigned us were long but excellent. She's quite serious, but not in a bad way at all.

May is an amazing and caring prof. She is super passionate about her research and this is reflected in her impactful, meaningful lectures. She is also super aware of student needs, she made tutorials optional and had interesting assignments. Her one weakness would be her tough grading but I suspect that this may be a department issue. Amazing prof!

Professor Farrales did not make her students feel welcomed in her course. Whenever students share concepts, her facial expression is cold unencouraging, I am not sure why she does this. She asks us to share, then ignore the student to move onto another topic. Overall, I felt very disrespected in her class. I hope she will work on this weakness.
